00001 #ifndef PANDORASET_H
00002 #define PANDORASET_H
00003 
00004 #include <stdlib.h>
00005 #include <assert.h>
00006 
00007 namespace PandoraUtils
00008 {
00009     //A simple Set class. We can append, remove, get the number of elements, 
00010     //get a raw pointer from the set and remove all the elements in the set.
00011     template<class T>
00012     class Set
00013     {
00014         public:
00015             //Constructor and destructor
00016             Set(const size_t size = 6, const size_t increment = 4);
00017             ~Set();
00018 
00019             //Append an element to the end of the array.
00020             void insert(const T& in);
00021 
00022             //Remove the element given from the set. Returns false if the set
00023             //doesn't contain the element.
00024             bool remove(const T& elem);
00025 
00026             //Get the number of elements in the set
00027             unsigned int getSize() const;
00028 
00029             //Get a pointer to the data
00030             T* getPointer();
00031 
00032             //Remove all the elements in the set
00033             void removeAll();
00034         protected:
00035             T *m_data;
00036             size_t m_elements; //The number of elements in the set
00037             size_t m_size; //The size of the array
00038             size_t m_increment; //What to increment the array size with
00039     };
00040 
00041     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00042     // Constructor
00043     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00044     template<class T>
00045     Set<T>::Set(size_t size, size_t increment)
00046     {
00047         m_data = new T[size];
00048         m_size = size;
00049         m_increment = increment;
00050         m_elements = 0;
00051     }
00052 
00053     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00054     // Destructor
00055     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00056     template<class T>
00057     Set<T>::~Set()
00058     {
00059         delete[] m_data;
00060     }
00061 
00062     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00063     // Appends an element to the first free place in the set. If no free spots,
00064     // we have to resize the array.
00065     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00066     template<class T>
00067     void Set<T>::insert(const T& in)
00068     {
00069         //If we have room for the element, no rearranging have to be done.
00070         if(m_elements < m_size) {
00071             m_data[m_elements++] = in;
00072         } else {
00073             //Checks if we are allowed to resize the set.
00074             assert(m_increment != 0 && 
00075                     "Not allowed to resize this set, but resize needed");
00076 
00077             //Resize the array
00078             T *tmp = new T[m_size + m_increment];
00079 
00080             //Copy the data to the new array
00081             for(int i = 0; i < m_size; ++i)
00082                 tmp[i] = m_data[i];
00083 
00084             //Delete the old array, copy the new large array to the data 
00085             //pointer and set the new size to the old size + the 
00086             //incrementation.
00087             delete[] m_data;
00088             m_data = tmp;
00089             m_size += m_increment;
00090 
00091             //Set the data in the set
00092             m_data[m_elements++] = in;
00093         }
00094     }
00095 
00096     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00097     // Get the number of elements in the set
00098     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099     template<class T>
00100     unsigned int Set<T>::getSize() const
00101     {
00102         return m_elements;
00103     }
00104  
00105     // Get the array itself
00106     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00107     template<class T>
00108     T* Set<T>::getPointer()
00109     {
00110         return m_data;
00111     }
00112 
00113     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00114     // Remove an element from the set. Returns true if the element is removed,
00115     // returns false otherwise
00116     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117     template<class T>
00118     bool Set<T>::remove(const T& elem)
00119     {
00120         size_t i = 0;
00121 
00122         //Search for the element.
00123         while(i < m_elements && m_data[i] != elem) {
00124             ++i;
00125         }
00126 
00127         //The element doesn't exist.
00128         if(i == m_elements)
00129             return false;
00130 
00131         //Shuffle all the remaining data
00132         for(;i < m_size - 1; ++i)
00133             m_data[i] = m_data[i + 1];
00134         m_data[i] = NULL;
00135 
00136         return true;
00137     }
00138 
00139     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00140     // Removes all the data from the set
00141     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------
00142     template<class T>
00143     void Set<T>::removeAll()
00144     {
00145         m_elements = 0;
00146         delete[] m_data;
00147         m_data = new T[m_size];
00148     }
00149 }
00150
